title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Social Welfare Consolidation Act
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 8) (Emergency Measures in 
the Public Interest-Jobseeker’s Benefit) Regulations 2020. 

(2) These Regulations and the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2020 shall be construed together as 
one and may be cited together as the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2020. 

Emergency measures in the public interest - jobseeker’s benefit 

Article 52H (inserted by article 3 of the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 6) (Emergency Measures in the 
Public Interest-Jobseeker’s Benefit) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 164 of 2020)) 
of 
the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control) 
(Amendment) Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 142 of 2007) is amended by the 
substitution of the following sub-article for sub-article (2): 

“(2) This article shall cease to have effect on 10 August 2020.”. 

The Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform consents to the forgoing 
Regulations. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

15 June, 2020. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 

Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 23rd June, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [223] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

17 June, 2020. 

REGINA DOHERTY, 

Minister for Employment Affairs and Social Protection. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [223]

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Social Welfare Consolidation Act
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations temporarily extend, until 10 August 2020, the period 
whereby the rule in section 62(4) of the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005 
is suspended. That rule, which provides that Jobseeker’s Benefit is paid only 
from the fourth day of unemployment, will be waived until 10 August 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [223] 5
